oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sameul Pickens letter, April 28, 1865, re: Sultana Disaster
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Samuel Pickens
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Samuel Pickens letter, U.S. Christian Commission Rooms, Memphis, Tenn., April 28, 1865, to mother and sister, Mrs. Sinthia (Cynthia) and Maria Pickens. ALS 2 pp. Re: surviving the Sultana Disaster. Mentions: was on way to Camp Chase [on the Sultana], left on the 27th, boilers burst-- the boat all to pieces, 1975 soldiers onboard, believes brother William is among the lost, he (Samuel) was blown overboard and clung to pieces of the boat to keep from drowning, was in the river about 3 hours, picked up in a yall (yawl).
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Correspondence; Disasters; Steamboat accidents;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Historical Photographs Copy Project (scan only; original returned to owner)
